title: Cognitive and Metacognitive Strategy-Integrated Social Studies Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Core social studies concepts and understanding of educational experiences
context.additional_context: An educational environment combining online (opening/reflection) and offline (collaborative activities) methods to help adult learners integrate cognitive/metacognitive strategies into social studies curriculum design

learning_goals: Learners can apply at least three cognitive strategies (note-taking, concept mapping, etc.) suitable for social studies lesson design to practical tasks.
Learners can reorganize social studies learning materials using metacognitive strategies (self-assessment, learning plan revision).
Learners can develop integrated cognitive-metacognitive instructional plans through project-based assessment and incorporate peer feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
